laazotea.indi

Class INDISexagesimalFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.INDISexagesimalFormatter

  • public class INDISexagesimalFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to format and parse numbers in sexagesimal format.
    Version:
    1.10, March 19, 2012
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

    • Constructor Detail

      • INDISexagesimalFormatter

        public INDISexagesimalFormatter(java.lang.String format)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs an instance of INDISexagesimalFormatter with a particular format.
        Parameters:
        format - The desired format
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the format is not correct: begins with %, ends with m and specifies a length and fractionLength in the form length.fractionLength. Valid fractionLengths are 3, 5, 6, 8 and 9. For example %5.3m.

    • Method Detail

      • getFormat

        public java.lang.String getFormat()
        Gets the format of this formatter.
        Returns:
        the format of this formatter.

      • parseSexagesimal2

        @Deprecated
public double parseSexagesimal2(java.lang.String number)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deprecated. 
        Parses a sexagesimal number. DO NOT USE IT. THIS IS A PRELIMINARY VERSION AND DOES NOT WORK AS EXPECTED. THIS METHOD WILL DISAPEAR IN FUTURE VERSIONS OF THE CLASS.
        Parameters:
        number - NOT USED
        Returns:
        NOT USED
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • parseSexagesimal

        public double parseSexagesimal(java.lang.String number)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parses a sexagesimal number. The input String is formatted as a maximum of three doubles separated by : ; or a blank space. The first number represents the number of degrees, the second is the number of minutes and the third is the number of seconds.
        Parameters:
        number - The number to be parsed.
        Returns:
        The parsed double.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number format is not correct.

      • format

        public java.lang.String format(java.lang.Double number)
        Fomats a number according to the number format os this formatter.
        Parameters:
        number - the number to be formatted.
        Returns:
        The formatted number as a String.
